definition: to rule a country
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
to rule according to the law
to rule a country according to the constitution
to manage state affairs/to govern the country
theocracy/also written 神權統治|神权统治[shen2 quan2 tong3 zhi4] or 神權政治|神权政治[shen2 quan2 zheng4 zhi4]

sentences.english: Tunisia should learn from China's experiences in developing its country.
sentences.chinese: 中国的治国经验对突尼斯有很好的借鉴作用。

sentences.english: This practice has nothing to do with the nation or society you live in.
sentences.chinese: 修行者也完全没有要治国，甚至平天下的宏愿。

sentences.english: Ruling the nation by the filial piety was the principle of governance and administration characteristics in power during Tang Xuan' zong.
sentences.chinese: 以孝治天下是唐玄宗的治国原则和施政特点。

sentences.english: Benevolence was an important Confucian advocacy in ruling states.
sentences.chinese: “仁政”是儒家治国的一项重要主张。

sentences.english: He said that rule by law is a fundamental strategy of China.
sentences.chinese: 他说，依法治国是中国的基本方略。

sentences.english: Literary talent fighting skill, governs a nation square slightly, I am a Jiao Jiao.
sentences.chinese: 文才武功，治国方略，我都是佼佼者。

sentences.english: Grain is the origin of the people's livelihood, the price of grain is a price foundation and food policy for the country.
sentences.chinese: 粮食是民生本源，粮价乃百价之基，粮政为治国要举。

sentences.english: You campaign in poetry. You govern in prose.
Recent years have shown that elections alone do not assure democratic rule.
sentences.chinese: 近年的情况表明，仅有选举并不能确保民主治国。

sentences.english: The administration and pacification of the states and world is the chief subject of the traditional chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: “治国平天下”，是中国传统文化的第一主题。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen advocated governing the country by political parties' during the period of political tutelage.
sentences.chinese: 孙中山主张在训政时期实行“以党治国”。

sentences.english: He, in ruling the country by law, specially stresses the law with content and the criminal law from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 在依法治国中，他特别强调要法而有实，刑自贵始。

sentences.english: The System of Constitutional Review is one of the rudimentary polices of the strategy of administering the country according to the Constitution.
sentences.chinese: 违宪审查制度是依宪治国方略中的根本制度之一。

sentences.english: In history lies all the secrets of statecraft.
sentences.chinese: 历史中有一切治国之道。

sentences.english: Administering our country by law is the basic polcy under the leadership of the party.
sentences.chinese: 依法治国是党领导人民治理国家的基本方略。

sentences.english: Morality and law are related with each other.
sentences.chinese: 德与法是治国之二柄，两者相辅相成，缺一不可。

definition: benevolent policy/humane government
to bring peace and stability to the country
rule by virtue/rule by setting virtuous example (Confucian ideal)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)

lit. rich country, strong army (idiom); slogan of legalist philosophers in pre-Han times/Make the country wealthy and the military powerful, slogan of modernizers in Qing China and Meiji Japan (Japanese pronunciation: Fukoku kyōhei)
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
national politics/archaic rank, "Minister of State"/common given name
politics/government affairs
to pacify the country
wise and capable/sagacious
The Book of Lord Shang, Legalist text of the 4th century BC

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
administration
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
benevolent integrity/high mindedness
a national policy
